document_data.name: Buckle Street
document_data.mainbody: '''Buckle Street''' was a hard-packed dirt and [[gravel]] paved road in [[Waterdeep]] that started in the city's [[Waterdeep/Trades Ward|Trades Ward]] and continued downward into the [[Waterdeep/Southern Ward|Southern Ward]].
document_data.Geography:
This road ran from north to south, running south off of [[River Street]] and cutting through [[Sahtyra's Lane]] before entering the Southern Ward, wherein it ended in a dead end.

In the Trades Ward, Buckle Street acted as the eastern terminus of [[Salabar Street]] and [[Wagonrace]], while in the Southern Ward it acted as the western terminus of [[Tornsar Alley]]
document_data.Notable Inhabitants: A number of merchants lived along this street, including [[Fylgard Onister]].
